title: Insurance as a Risk Management Tool
description: This chapter explores how insurance functions as a risk transfer mechanism and covers the various types of insurance products, their key components, and how they protect against different kinds of financial risks.
learning_objectives: Understand the key concepts of insurance, such as premiums, deductibles, coverage limits, and exclusions
Identify the different types of insurance and their specific purposes (health, auto, home, renters, life, disability, and liability)
Recognize how insurance fits into an overall risk management strategy and how it provides financial protection
Apply this knowledge to make informed decisions about insurance needs for the future

skill_builder.title: Identifying Insurance Types
skill_builder.description: An interactive activity where students match different insurance types to real-life situations that require specific coverage.
